text: In the early days, Cornelius and Teodor seem to be interchangeable.  Huzzah for progressive character development.

text: Strange, I just said the same thing about the Flavor Flav strip two days prior to this one. However, I have to disagree with you in this case as Teodor would not say, "Oh, AIDS."

text: That fact just made this strip so much better.  Big chubby hearts.

text: In one of the comics (http://chappie.stanford.edu/archives/1996-1997/this_land_america/american_nightmare_-_starring_monkey_boy/), it seems like Death even has Phillipe's shorts. What is Onstad trying to say?

text:
the real question should be...

"whyd someone screw a monkey with aids?"

seriously, they couldnt find one without it?

name: gowerski
text: Just wanna break the point of the strip, but it was actually someone EATING a monkey that transmitted AIDS to humans.. And then them having sex.

name: tekende
text: AIDS monkey is a powerful aphrodisiac.

name: boredom_man
text: Man, c'mon. You're not one of these pseudo-Catholics who consider oral sex to not be sex, are you? Screw, eat... it's all good fuckin'

name: redjoker
text: wow, eating a monkey and then proceeding to have intercourse with it is even more appaling... no thanks for that mental image

name: wino
text: what came first... the monkey or the aids.  these are the questions we need to be asking.

name: senor_diablo
text: Another great strip from early on!

name: ambala
text: This is what sets Cornelius apart - he asks the important questions.

name: mortshire
text: bongo the beatnik sock monkey's first and last ignominious appearance.  i'll stick with uncle gabby, thanks.

name: jokercross
text: Should bring back the monkey.  He looks like a dude who could easily have a deal with Ray's label.

name: rosie
text: A comment left by rosie was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by daedala_x, EM2, envika, Comrade_Tom)

name: swatson
text: (I think it is a sock monkey)

name: baryonyx
text: I enjoy your icon immensely. Every time I click a link it goes into slow-motion.

name: swatson
text:
If you watch it long enough the left pikachu falls in a bloody heap and the right one says "Pika-pi-pi pika-pi"*

*"I just felt like destroying something beautiful"

name: ford
text: The twin references made me laugh out loud.  Chubby.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I heard now they think AIDS probably jumped over to humans from eating infected monkeys, not screwing them. So I guess Ray better watch out, what with his taste for forbidden bushmeats and all.

name: spectre
text: Yeah, that's the current theory. Monkeys eat crops and produce, starving subsistence farmers gotta eat the monkeys. They also fed slaughtered monkey carcasses to pigs. People on the edge of starvation make choices, you gotta respect it.

name: deusoma
text: Wait, did people ever actually think AIDS came from someone screwing a monkey? I just assumed a monkey bit a dude.

name: rowboat
text: I believe that folks still prescribe to this theory in the American South.

name: notcool
text:
Personally, I like to believe that all terrible diseases start out with interspecies molestation.

Do you want to hear my theory on Swine Flu

PROUD TO BE AN EMT

name: peterjoel
text:
You can't get HIV from eating infected monkey meat - unless you have a cut in your mouth. Also, monkeys are too dissimilar from humans for the virus to have come directly from them, without going via something more similar, like chimpanzees.

Interestingly, last year they traced the point where the virus spread from beast to man:
http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2006/may/26/aids.topstories3

name: history
text: I'm not attaching any significance to this, but I just want to point out that some of the researchers in this article were from Alabama.

name: biznart
text: "Forbidden bushmeats" sounds like something that would be more Pat's game than Ray's.  /spoiler

name: alejandroadam
text: I remeber them telling us about AIDS and HIV alot in middle school and HS (though out the 90's) and we all could never figure out the bit about monkeys

name: alejandroadam
text: "The male latex condom, if used correctly without oil-based lubricants, is the single most effective available technology to reduce the sexual transmission of HIV and other sexually transmitted infections" from WIKI. I remember being lied to repeatedly by every sex ed teacher I ever had about this.

name: stuart
text: That's because, technically, abstinence is. They're required to say that to get state funding.

name: equinn2006
text: I wasn't aware that not having sex was a technology.

name: mikeleffel2
text: Hell I'm a damned cyborg then.

name: alejandroadam
text: no. they said in black and white "condoms DO NOT IN ANYWAY prevent AIDS at all." also who remebers "you would have to wear 70 condoms to prevent contracting aids" it was a bold face lie. not a technical thing.

name: tekende
text: 70 condoms would also handily prevent orgasm.

name: bjorntd
text: Unless having sex with plastic bags is basically your thing.

name: rowboat
text: Nothing can ever prevent orgasm. You'd may as well try to prevent...the ocean.

name: woodenteeth
text: My, my... I hope you have a hoseable sheet/bedroom.

name: rowboat
text:
I do, and I hose them regularly.

With my hose.

name: woodenteeth
text: That does NOT solve your problem. Your sexy, sexy problem.

name: rowboat
text: If cumming all over everything I own is a problem, I don't want a solution.

name: woodenteeth
text: Either way I found carpet cleaner works.

name: notcool
text: Correct. I wanna cum.

name: notcool
text: Correct. I wanna cum.

name: rowboat
text: Happy we could give you a multiple.

name: notcool
text: Well, if Assetbar was going to screw up a post...

name: history
text: This may be my lack of knowledge of chemistry, but what would a lubricant be if not oil-based?  Cream based?

name: alejandroadam
text: water based lubes, and silicon based lubes are basically all you will ever see in a lube for comdoms or intended for aid in intercourse. personally I recomend water based on account that it builds up less and it won't damage silicon based products also commonly used during 'the miracle"
